faqs.question: How can my business support Kiva for less than $10,000 minimum?
faqs.answer:
Even if your can't give more than $10,000 there are many ways to support Kiva.
  • Create a Kiva account in the name of your business and get started making loans. Share your company's support by linking directly to your public lender page, and let your community see all the borrowers you've supported on Kiva.
  • Create a company lending team and encourage your employees to join and track your collective lending impact on Kiva.
  • Give others the opportunity to make a loan by purchasing Kiva Cards for your employees or customers.

faqs.question: Can I use your logo on my business website?
faqs.answer: For promotion of Kiva we encourage the use of our Kiva Supporters logo on your company's website and also link to your company's public lender page or lending team (if applicable). We allow use of our official logo for supporters who?ve contributed $10,000 or more in the past year. Please contact us at development@kiva.org for permission.

faqs.question: How can my corporation match employees' donations to Kiva?s operating costs?
faqs.answer: Many corporations support the causes that matter most to their employees by matching their donations. If your company has a donation matching program, you can encourage your employees to submit matching paper work using these instructions.

faqs.question: Are there other ways to donate to Kiva besides online?
faqs.answer:
To make a donation to Kiva's operational expenses via check, please make your check payable to 'Kiva Microfunds' and mail it with your return address to:

Kiva Attn: Chief Development Officer
875 Howard Street, Suite 340
San Francisco, CA 94103

If you would prefer to make a gift of stock, or send your donation via wire, please contact us at development@kiva.org and we will send you instructions.

Click here to learn more about estate planning, or contact us at development@kiva.org for more information.

faqs.question: Does Kiva form partnerships with individuals, corporations and foundations from outside the U.S.?
faqs.answer:
Yes! We would welcome the opportunity to discuss partnerships with those located outside of the U.S. Kiva has partnered with companies and foundations from countries around the world, including Malaysia, the Netherlands and Spain.

Kiva also has the ability to accept tax-advantageous contributions from corporations, foundations and individuals from Hong Kong and the United Kingdom, through our partner Shared Impact. Unfortunately, Hong Kong and the United Kingdom are the only countries outside of the U.S. where tax-advantageous donations are possible.

faqs.question: Does Kiva offer tax advantageous partnership opportunities?
faqs.answer: Yes! Grants, loan matching and employee engagement programs can be tax-advantageous if coming from the U.S., United Kingdom or Hong Kong. Contact us at development@kiva.org for more details.
